strings.Value: "I don't even know if this means anything to you, Harrim. But I'm glad you're among my companions."
"We have to go. The Lantern King won't wait..."

{n}Harrim is fiddling with his beard pensively.{/n} "A menacing hour. A simple mind might see in it the end of times, and the triumph of {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g}. But alas, these are only the games of a foolish deity, wrapped in the vanity of the {g|First World}First World{/g}..."
{n}Harrim looks at you, astonished, as if he's just awakened and opened his eyes.{/n} "Your words seem strange to me. But something in them warms my old soul..."

"This is true. Everything unfolds the best possible way. If we meet our death in the coming battle, it will be a wonderful ending. If we win... although it's a pointless act... I will also be satisfied. It would be wrong to bow to this self-proclaimed {g|LanternKing}'lantern' king{/g}."
{n}Harrim shakes his head with disapproval.{/n}
"Indeed. We must quench that false light, so it doesn't confuse the souls of those who look on it."
